title: Kibble-Zurek mechanism in driven underdamped Brownian motion
abstract:
Kibble-Zurek mechanism is widely known to appear in the transverse-field
quantum Ising chain in the thermodynamic limit at zero temperature, having
notorious characteristics, like the divergence of its relaxation time. In this
work, I present the same effect in a simple system, the driven underdamped
Brownian motion. Using linear response theory, I show the appropriate limits
where the Kibble-Zurek mechanism happens. The divergence of the relaxation
time, the high-temperature condition in the initial thermal equilibrium state,
a new Kibble-Zurek scaling at sudden processes, and the pausing effect in the
optimal protocol are presented as consequences.
